Articles.Content:
aloha from me .

im danish .. 34 years ..

and very new to ksp (got 1 satelite to orbit kerbin thou).

i might need alot of tips and tricks along the way ..

for examble :

is there a expansion for steam i can use , that covers all the parts ?

and is there 1 to help me build more accurate ?

is there a place in here where i can find help to solve all my "noob" questions ?

i love to look at some good trials on vidioÃ‚Â´s (youtube or what ever) if you know some good ...

well that would be all from me right now..

roger and over

Welcome Jaysworld007.

is there a expansion for steam i can use , that covers all the parts ?

What do you mean by covering all the parts?

Also the only relation between Steam is only used as an alternative distribution platform for KSP.

Most addons can be found on the appropriate forum or spaceport

and is there 1 to help me build more accurate ?

You can use some plug-in as Kerbal Engineer Redux

is there a place in here where i can find help to solve all my "noob" questions ?

That would be the Gameplay Questions and Tutorials forum Look at the tutorial subforum and already existing thread. If you can't find the answer, just post a new thread.

i love to look at some good trials on vidioÃ‚Â´s (youtube or what ever) if you know some good ...

most known one would be:

, but there are a lot of others, you can see a lot on the tutorial forum.

Keep on playing

i love to look at some good trials on vidioÃ‚Â´s (youtube or what ever) if you know some good ...

UbioZur recommended Scott Manley, definitely a prime choice. The man understands spaceflight almost as well as most of us know how to breathe.

Another good person to look at for beginner tutorials is Pebble Garden, all the words are on screen, letting you pause and read while looking right at what is being talked about, and it's nothing but good, soothing music.

After watching some of their work, you should be ready to start making your own designs and sending Kerbals into the Great Beyond (take that as you will )

thx alot for those nice and fast answers

Scott Manley is allrdy a kind of hero to me , but he have made so many vidios and most is not for a novice like me ...

but he did allrdy help me getting my probe into orbit of kerbin ..

Pebble Garden i dont know , but ill bet you i know all heÃ‚Â´s vidios soon if they can help me

ive been looking for a addon on http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/ , but is confusing for me, there so many and i really dont know what to download and install.

but im fairly new to the forum and i belive i might find some in here .

when i asked about being more accurate i ment, when i was putting a spacecraft together and want part to sit in a different angle ..

sorry if use the wrong words sometimes ... well im danish

when i asked about being more accurate i ment, when i was putting a spacecraft together and want part to sit in a different angle

Try using the WSADQE keys while holding a part. Using SHIFT will make smaller rotations.

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

Edited August 25, 2013 by Capt'n Skunky

Capt-n-Skunky .. u are the man ......THE MAN .. shift ... bloody "#Ã‚Â¤"!"#Ã‚Â¤ .. its right there under my nose ... well to my defence , my nose is very big hehe

thx alot

hov can i make a rover ? and get it on the rocket ... if i save and load the rover the rocket isent there any more ... so i need someway to get the rover and rocket together..

hope you help me againe..

jays
